channel.title: Apple Macs
channel.description:
My Windows broke down so I hooked my Apple Mac OS X 10.4.11 up to the internet, and I was wondering how I get private servers to work on Macs?
The .bat files just open up in TextEdit and there's no way to actually run them. I've searched for it on numerous forums but the right topic never comes up.
I was wondering if anyone knows or has a link to a forum/topic that explains Macs and Private Servers, please.
Oh and is this the right section?

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @HumanNature HumanNature™
item.description:
@HumanNature wrote:

Thank you very much Cocoa, I sent him/her a personal message.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @HumanNature HumanNature™
item.description:
@HumanNature wrote:

I got Stuffit Expander, that’s what I used to decompile the client.rar, I’ll try it on the .bat and a .exe file but I doubt it’ll work.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @Patrickftw Patrickftw
item.description:
@Patrickftw wrote:

I think you need a installation for .exe .bat files etc… My dad had a mac and the guy from apple said that. =S

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @speedhighway speedhighway
item.description:
@speedhighway wrote:

ya use bootcamp i forgot i tried that too, didnt work for me cuz i used a copy of windows xp i got from a releative

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @HumanNature HumanNature™
item.description:
@HumanNature wrote:

Right, I’ve found information about it from Google - only thing is I didn’t have a copy of Windows installation because it was pirated… I’ll see if it’s possible to download from somewhere.

I can’t thank you lot enough.

Ok, now here’s some steps I’ve done:

• I downloaded a client source
• I “Opened With” the Compile and Run.bat with Terminal, and it processed and returned this:

Last login: Thu Mar 27 00:44:25 on ttyp1 /Volumes/Save\ Disk/Private\ Servers/The\ Client/The\ Client/Compile\ and\ run.bat; exit Welcome to Darwin! cpc2-nthc8-0-0-cust936:~ Dan$ /Volumes/Save\ Disk/Private\ Servers/The\ Client/The\ Client/Compile\ and\ run.bat; exit /Volumes/Save Disk/Private Servers/The Client/The Client/Compile and run.bat: line 1: @echo: command not found /Volumes/Save Disk/Private Servers/The Client/The Client/Compile and run.bat: line 2: color: command not found /Volumes/Save Disk/Private Servers/The Client/The Client/Compile and run.bat: line 3: Title: command not found /Volumes/Save Disk/Private Servers/The Client/The Client/Compile and run.bat: line 4: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe: command not found Unable to access jarfile Updater.jar Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client /Volumes/Save Disk/Private Servers/The Client/The Client/Compile and run.bat: line 7: pause: command not found logout [Process completed]

Now I have very limited knowledge with Macs on “coding” etc. so does anyone have any ideas on the next steps I should take, I’m going to continue to trial and error, try and get the correct code .bat.

Does anyone know Java is done any differently on Macs and if so to what extent?

Now I know it’s not going to work but it’s a tincy step forward lol, as I said before, Moparisthebest has done it, so it can be done!

Read full topic

Never heard of it.

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @HumanNature HumanNature™
item.description:
@HumanNature wrote:

Bah okay thanks for clearing that up guys. I’ve heard people say they’ve hosted from a Mac before, whether they was lying or not is anybody’s guess.

EDIT: Okay, I’ve just figured there has got to be a way because Mopar has already done it with his Client.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @speedhighway speedhighway
item.description:
@speedhighway wrote:

u cant make a server on a mac, srry. unless there is a JDK 6 for mac that i don’t know about, but pretty sure there isnt since i tried looking for it all over on my old mac

Read full topic

item.title: Apple Macs
item.dc:creator: @meowmix101 meowmix101
item.description:
@meowmix101 wrote:

Actually there is no way to host a server from a Mac. If I were you, I would eather look for hosters, or I would try to figure out a way to host a server from a mac. There are no tutrals on it, so you would have to do it all by ur self. =-(

Read full topic
